text: Dear Ma'am, Sir, Thank you so much for having me here.
I am Dhruv Gupta and I wish to apply into NTUS, PhD program for biomedical devices.
I will begin with my academic journey.
My academic journey has been deeply rooted in exploring the intersection of engineering and health sector.
I am pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Biology in the Indian Institute of Science, my beloved.
And I have consistently sought to blend learnings from biology and physiology with the passion for engineering and robotics.
During my time at IISC, I have taken courses in both these areas of interest and subjects which I have bridged it to.
So for device making I have taken courses in operating systems and embedded systems.
For biology I have taken courses in human physiology, medical neuroscience and neurobiology labs.
And as combinational courses I have taken product manufacturing via medical devices, diagnostics and devices including neuroimaging.
My interest in the health sector, we have gradually over a period of 3 years.
I in fact first got to know of the term medtech through an Estonian career accelerator which I joined remotely in my first semester at IISC.
I kept the concept in the term medtech in mind when I applied for a medical observation at AIMS Delhi under the mentorship of Karnulal Dr. P.K. Sadhi,
former Neurologist to President MP J. Abdul Kalam.
After acceptance I was encouraged to record high frequency problems happening at the hospital faced by patients.
Hospital acquired infections made it to the top of the list.
At the time I was also interested in Nanda Parashat and that led me to found my startup Viroak with 3 co-founders and a team of 6.
We received a seed funding of 10 lakhs of 1 million Indian rupees.
We are currently building an MVP, a minimal viable product.
I have submitted patents for 3 devices and are expecting to reduce the cost of our product.
After Viroak, me and part of my team decided to apply to the Indian Ministry of Defence for a summer project for helping soldiers with spinal cord injuries
and rehabilitated them using a robotic gate-trainer.
I designed and was approved by the Indian Chief of Army.
Apart from my work has been facilitated by the entrepreneurship set of IISC and IEEE IISC.
As of February 2024, I am the student chair of CS Society of IEEE and Vice President of the entrepreneurship set of IISC.
Leaning a team is mostly logistics.
I sometimes prefer roles which allow me to focus on my developing and defining my skill set or sometimes a challenge.
I am participating in a competition by IISRO.
It is a minimal viable competition which our team has cleared the first few rounds of and have received funding of 25 lakh rupees
or 2.5 million in need of rupees to further our project.
Looking ahead, my goal is to continue leveraging my engineering acumen to drive effective and efficient solutions in the health tech sector.
My core strengths are leadership, innovation and a unique skill set of robotics, metric devices and background in biology
combined with acute market awareness.
I also wish to communicate that my personal mission is innovation of social impact.
I want to help people with what I learned.
Hence, I always seek to understand the application and implementation strategy of any idea first.
Me, an MSCist, founded an NGO, Devi Falhar, to distribute menstrual pads to slums in our city.
We soon figured out that it was not access to pads but rather perception of periods by the men in the house which is the main problem.
And we switched to teaching young boys in the slum about period pain and menstrual health.
We have some of the huge change there after in the feedback that we received from the women in the slums.
So, I would be most happy to work with projects where I get to work with people and understand why they are using my project and what they really, really need.
Thank you so much for considering my application. It's an honor to be here.
I'm eager to bring my perspective and skill set to NTU, Singapore and contribute to the estimated situation.
I look forward to the opportunity to discuss how my background, skills and enthusiasm align with your PhD program. Thank you.
